reviewText: This is a great dvd concert. The whole band the singer as well did a great job. I am a picture and audio snob, and in my option, this was a very well put together dvd concert. The picture and audio is very good. You will not be disappointed!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a big Tesla fan, have been for years!  I never seen them in concert so this dvd was a big treat to watch!  Having it filmed in Minnesota was an extra thrill since that's where I'm from and them being one of my favorite bands!  All I can say is to purchase this because they put on one hell of a show!  The sound is spectacular and they actually communicate to the audience!  Rock on Minnesota!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Even though the band is aging, this is by far their best DVD release to date.  The songlist is great from start to finish with some old and some new.  There are nice segways inbetween every 3rd song or so that tell a little background about the selections, and the band truely demonstrate that they are in the business for the love of music.  The musicianship is excellent.  As for the DVD set up itself, top notch for being non-hd or blue ray.  Does upconvert nicely on my unit.  The menu's are easy to follow and the background graphics are good on them as well.  The extra features also continue to give good glimpses into tesla and their fans, along with a bit of history.  A must for a fan of tesla, great introduction for newbees.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Very long show, many songs, has to be over 2 hours worth.  Jeff was spot on with the vocals, Frank was amazing as was the rest of the band of course.  It's hard to believe they can still rock this hard after over 20 years. Finally we get an electric DVD!!  Their new song is awesome (Dear Private Ledbetter).  Can't wait for this to come out, there were at least 6 cameras so if the sound quality is good which im sure it will be, youre gonna be looking at a Tesla masterpiece!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow!! this dvd is pretty amazing , they really caught the band on a good night , they really lock in & put on a great rock n roll show !The sound is really mixed well also , one of the better sounding rock n roll dvd's out there .Also some great bonus features , great look at all the bands gear , Touring , the fans etc.  A++++ job from one of the great rock bands of our time , Nicely done & a must own

reviewText: Very Satisfied , Tesla rocked , vocals could be better but the overall music and guitar playing is five stars !
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been a fan of Tesla for a very long time and I think they're one of the best bands of our time and I'm very happy to finally have a Tesla concert on dvd, I watched it last night and I was thrilled, after all this time Tesla still rocks hard, "getting better every day",  just a little detail, some information from the backcover is wrong, concert running time is 126 minutes and not 2  hrs. and audio is dolby 2.0 and not 5.1, still is very good, anyway this is a magnificent concert that every Tesla fan would enjoy, full of energy and power enough to bring you back to life again, great concert thank you Tesla.
summary: I love those lazy days and crazy nights

reviewText: Truly one of the best rock band to come from the 80's. A great live show on dvd.
Title: N/A

reviewText: TESLA flew under the radar during the 80's, for the most part, though they had several 'hits' along the way.  Very under-rated band with the lead guitarist being almost a complete unknown for someone so talented!  They play a very tight set here, they look good and sound great.  Just enough interviews and tidbits to make it a nice package - not to mention, a very inexpensive one.  Enjoy...it brought back lots of memories for me.
summary: If you love TESLA, you'll love this DVD

reviewText: Tesla live dvd comin atcha live indeed, This is a great live dvd for all Tesla fans sold out in Minnesota in 2008, featuring new member Dave Rude, this is a great live performance for all fans with new material as well as a cover of U.F.Os Rock Bottom! and a rock solid show.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Blue collar 80's hard rock veterans, Tesla, deliver a solid, no frills show that captures the spirit of the band, in this 120 minute performance recorded at the Myth nightclub, in St. Paul, Minnesota.  The quintet has remained mostly intact since their 1987 debut, Mechanical Resonance.  Original members Jeff Keith (vocals), Frank Hannon (guitar), Brian Wheat (bass), and Troy Luccketta (percussion), are still rocking hard, after over twenty years in the business.  The newest member is guitarist Dave Rude, a talented player who seems to fit in well.Not neatly falling into a musical category, Tesla's sound includes some hard rock, metal, blues and acoustic rock, and the band explores these areas in their live show.  Tesla cranks out some heavy, gutsy rock, powered by Jeff Keith's raspy vocals.  Frank Hannon impressively duplicates live, his signature solos and licks, and Mr. Rude shows what he can do as well.  Tesla didn't really have commercial hits, but the song selection includes most of their well known songs like Hang Tough, Edison's Medicine, Signs, Love Song, Modern Day Cowboy, Heaven's Trail, Comin' atcha Live, Paradise, Song and Emotion, and a very cool cover of UFO's Rock Bottom.The production quality of the DVD is very good, with ample camera coverage, and cuts that don't make you dizzy.  For the most part, the focus is on the action.  When someone solos, the camera stays on the player so you can see what they are playing.  What a revelation!  If only other concert videos would do the same.  The DVD menu is pretty cool, but does take a while to load.  The bonus materials are pretty lengthy, and provide a fun and interesting look at the band members, life on the road, and the fans.
Title: N/A
